channel.title: World War Z is coming.
channel.description:
The movie, that is.
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcwTxRuq-uk[/url]
I'm not sure how I feel about this. On one hand, great! They're finally making it! On the other hand, they're taking away the slow, rotting zombies, but I guess that's necessary to make this movie paced well.
What do you think?

item.title: World War Z is coming.
item.dc:creator: Dr_Karamazov
item.description:
Pyro:

Exactly. The book succeeded because it wasn’t all about killing zombies, it was about people; how they confronted the catastrophe, how they dealt with the aftermath, etc. Some of the the things they touch on in the book, like that one chapter with the submarines, barely even involved zombies at all.

If we imagine that the ‘point’ was in Southern Texas, then this film would be somewhere in northern Siberia. That is how much this film missed the point.

Read full topic

item.description:
danielsangeo:

There’s only one way to go now with zombie movies:

Zombies vs. Zombies.

Strippers vs Zombies.

The acting was near Zombie-like. Badum Tish.

item.title: World War Z is coming.
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
brokenfridgehinge:

Trailer didn’t do it for me. Way too much CG, doesn’t look like its based on the book at all. Mindless Hollywood style instead of documentary style like the book. What made the novel great was that it explored the outbreak and aftermath of the pandemic from many different perspectives, made it feel like a truly global thing. This just looks so generic and bland… ugh. Pretty disappointing to be honest. It could have been amazing if they stuck to the source material.

Exactly. The book succeeded because it wasn’t all about killing zombies, it was about people; how they confronted the catastrophe, how they dealt with the aftermath, etc. Some of the the things they touch on in the book, like that one chapter with the submarines, barely even involved zombies at all.

Read full topic

item.title: World War Z is coming.
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
And North Korea disappeared.

Triage:

they’re taking away the slow, rotting zombies

Kind of dumb, considering that’s the only reason they were able to win the “war” in the book.

darkone:

have knowing this, a show where they make guns did an episode where they made a gun for killing zombies because of this (was about 6-7 month ago)

They had Max Brooks on Sons of Guns. He mentioned that they’re making Zombie Survival Guide and World War Z movies.

Read full topic

item.title: World War Z is coming.
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
It looks like the call of duty of zombie movies.

Which is to say, if you like watching lots of explosions, and actiony things that are completely impossible and improbable and are purely for the sake of seeing how far they can push their special effects guys because they have twice as many special effects guys working on the movie because they didn’t bother to hire writers, then this will probably be enjoyable for you.

If you enjoy movies like 28 days later, you will probably just vomit explosively for two and a half hours.

Read full topic
